solution_line_template: Twice the width is {width} x {multiplier_for_twice} = <<{width}*{multiplier_for_twice}={twice_width}>>{twice_width} meters.
The length of the rectangular flowerbed is {twice_width} - {length_less}= <<{twice_width}-{length_less}={length}>>{length} meters.
Since the rectangular flower bed has {num_lengths} equal lengths, then it needs {length} x {num_lengths} = <<{length}*{num_lengths}={total_length_fence}>>{total_length_fence} meters of fence.
The rectangular bed has also {num_widths} equal widths, so it needs {width} x {num_widths} = <<{width}*{num_widths}={total_width_fence}>>{total_width_fence} meters of fence.
Therefore, the rectangular flower bed needs a total of {total_length_fence} + {total_width_fence} = <<{total_length_fence}+{total_width_fence}={total_fence}>>{total_fence} meters of fence.
